style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span>Prepare laptop:<br><br></span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Attention: laptop needs to support native UEFI boot</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span>Use a laptop with at least 8GB RAM and a 256GB SSD<br><br>Download Ubuntu LTS 20.04.1:  </span><span style="text-decoration-skip-ink:none;-webkit-text-decoration-skip:none;color:#1155cc;text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ubuntu.com/download/server&sa=D&ust=1611126796110000&usg=AOvVaw2nSBASqMXjmKforhRO1Mca" style="color:inherit;text-decoration:inherit">https://ubuntu.com/download/server</a></span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"> (Option 3)</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span>Use a USB imaging tool like rufus to make a bootable USB stick with Ubuntu Server: </span><span style="text-decoration-skip-ink:none;-webkit-text-decoration-skip:none;color:#1155cc;text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rufus.ie/&sa=D&ust=1611126796111000&usg=AOvVaw0Tv7jNysG3X4_X3bzYQLdm" style="color:inherit;text-decoration:inherit">https://rufus.ie/</a></span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span>When imaging is done, power on the laptop and enter BIOS (F10)<br><br>Go to “Boot Options”<br><br>Set Boot Mode to “UEFI Native (Without CSM)”</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Press F10 to save settings.<br><br>Plugin the USB Stick and reboot the laptop</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Press F9 during boot/power on to select a boot device.<br><br>Make sure that the USB stick is selected as a UEFI source.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select “Install Ubuntu Server” when prompted in GRUB</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">When installation is started, select “English as your language</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select “Update to the new installer” if the option is available</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select English US as keyboard layout</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Check if the connection is available and if you’re receiving an IP address from a DHCP server.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Skip through the Proxy address and Mirror address screen to keep settings default</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select “Use an entire disk” and make sure your SSD is selected</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select Done to advance to next screen</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">At the bottom of the screen, check of the mounting point of partition 1 is /boot/efi<br>If it’s not, you didnt boot into an UEFI source USB stick, but a regular BIOS/Legacy device</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select Done and Continue afterwards</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Fill out the Name fields and password fields to your liking</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Preferred options are:<br>Your Name: Administrator<br>Your server’s name: moodleserver<br>Pick a username: moodleserver<br>Password: moodle</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select Done when everything is filled out</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span>Select “Install OpenSSH Server”<br></span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">This is important for setting up a remote connection later</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Don’t import SSH Identity</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select Done<br><br>Skip the Featured Server Snaps</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Let the installer do its thing untill “Reboot” is available</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select Reboot  to complete the installation</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Remove the USB stick and press ENTER</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Option steps if laptop does not boot Ubuntu Server</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Go into BIOS when powering on (F10)<br>Go to Boot Options<br>Select “Customized Boot”<br>Use the following path “\EFI\ubuntu\grubx64.efi</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">In UEFI Boot Order, prioritize Customized Boot as first Boot option of the UEFI Boot Order</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Boot into Ubuntu Server</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Enter username and password when server is booted</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Now type “ip addr show” and make note of your IP address.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.0;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Preparing remote connection for installation of moodle on Ubuntu Server</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span>On your Workstation, download PuTTY: </span><span style="text-decoration-skip-ink:none;-webkit-text-decoration-skip:none;color:#1155cc;text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/latest.html&sa=D&ust=1611126796115000&usg=AOvVaw2iSxA2AUbXdYwDnJuYAWzk" style="color:inherit;text-decoration:inherit">https://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/latest.html</a></span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">After downloading, open PuTTY and enter the ip address of Ubuntu Server and make sure SSH is selected.<br>Click on the “Open” button</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Click “Yes”</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">PuTTY should now show a prompt “login as:”</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Type in the username and password to verify connection</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.0;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">To give access from the outside world, it’s recommended to use Anydesk. The operator (Kennan) can use Anydesk to view the contents of your workstation, including the PuTTY session. This prevents the opening of ports 22 (and possibly others) and keeps your network secure.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.0;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.0;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.0;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">In order to complete this tutorial, you will need access to the following on an Ubuntu 18.04 (or 20.04) server:</span></p><ul class="lst-kix_8t3gb1ui30vb-0 start" style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding-top:12pt;list-style-position:inside;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.0;text-indent:45pt;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span>You can use either VI (lightweight editor) or VIM (heavyweight editor),</span><span style="text-decoration-skip-ink:none;-webkit-text-decoration-skip:none;text-decoration:line-through"> however, if you wish to use VIM you will need to install it </span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">vim is already installed on Ubuntu Server by default</span></li><li style="padding-top:12pt;list-style-position:inside;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.0;text-indent:45pt;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Download image from video.nts.nl/mediafilesystem/videoserver.iso</span></li></ul><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">sudo apt-get install vim</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.0;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><ul class="lst-kix_rja099aea8h3-0 start" style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">A sudo user on your server</span></li><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">An Apache2 web server, which you can install with sudo apt install apache2</span></li></ul><h2 id="h.9ywxgyd4a23o" style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;font-weight:700;padding-left:0;font-size:12pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.0;page-break-after:avoid;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"> </span></h2><div>
</div> </body>
</html>

page.title: 10.4.2 Create the Directory Structure
page.contents:
<html><head><meta content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" http-equiv="content-type"><style type="text/css"> @import url(https://themes.googleusercontent.com/fonts/css?kit=fpjTOVmNbO4Lz34iLyptLcWpXo_CmM6erK5IinBZ-8PVus-cM8ZA-pXCeyO7rfhH96xlbbE5D7Gw2o7jubnkMA); ol.lst-kix_r456n852bn2i-4.start{counter-reset:lst-ctn-kix_r456n852bn2i-4 0}.lst-kix_lqn4qjri3x5y-0 > li{counter-increment:lst-ctn-kix_lqn4qjri3x5y-0}.lst-kix_wsoboy172f2i-6 > li{counter-increment:lst-ctn-kix_wsoboy172f2i-6}ol.lst-kix_gmiw55mg1mu4-7.start{counter-reset:lst-ctn-kix_gmiw55mg1mu4-7 0}.lst-kix_y0m8r9d8a104-0 > li:before{content:"● "}ol.lst-kix_e4x4wu5kor0l-0{list-style-type:none}.lst-kix_wsoboy172f2i-6 > li:before{content:"" counter(lst-ctn-kix_wsoboy172f2i-6,decimal) ". "}ol.lst-kix_e4x4wu5kor0l-2{list-style-type:none}.lst-kix_y0m8r9d8a104-2 > li:before{content:"■ "}ol.lst-kix_t7kdp41k84uk-5.start{counter-reset:lst-ctn-kix_t7kdp41k84uk-5 0}ol.lst-kix_e4x4wu5kor0l-1{list-style-type:none}ol.lst-kix_e4x4wu5kor0l-4{list-style-type:none}.lst-kix_y0m8r9d8a104-1 > li:before{content:"○ "}.lst-kix_y0m8r9d8a104-3 > li:before{content:"● "}ol.lst-kix_e4x4wu5kor0l-3{list-style-type:none}.lst-kix_wsoboy172f2i-7 > li:before{content:"" counter(lst-ctn-kix_wsoboy172f2i-7,lower-latin) ". "}ol.lst-kix_e4x4wu5kor0l-6{list-style-type:none}ol.lst-kix_e4x4wu5kor0l-5{list-style-type:none}ol.lst-kix_e4x4wu5kor0l-8{list-style-type:none}ol.lst-kix_e4x4wu5kor0l-7{list-style-type:none}.lst-kix_wsoboy172f2i-8 > li:before{content:"" counter(lst-ctn-kix_wsoboy172f2i-8,lower-roman) ". We’ll be using example domain names, highlighted below. You should replace these with your actual domain names.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span>·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:400">         </span><span style="font-weight:400;font-family:"Courier New"">sudo mkdir -p /var/www/moodle.com/html<br></span><span>·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:400">         </span><span style="font-weight:400;font-family:"Courier New"">sudo mkdir -p /var/www/video.com/html<br></span><span>·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:400">         </span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Courier New";font-style:normal">sudo mkdir -p /var/www/project.com/html</span></p><h3 id="h.9ywxgyd4a23o-11" style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;font-weight:700;padding-left:0;font-size:11pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.0;page-break-after:avoid;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:11pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></h3><div>
</div> </body>
</html>

style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">We should now change the permissions to our current non-root user to be able to modify the files.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span>·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:400">         </span><span style="font-weight:400;font-family:"Courier New"">sudo chown -R $USER:$USER /var/www/moodle.com/html<br></span><span>·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:400">         </span><span style="font-weight:400;font-family:"Courier New"">sudo chown -R $USER:$USER /var/www/video.com/html<br></span><span>·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:400">         </span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Courier New";font-style:normal">sudo chown -R $USER:$USER /var/www/project.com/html</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"> Additionally, we’ll ensure that read access is permitted to the general web directory and all of the files and folders it contains so that pages can be served correctly.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"><br>·         sudo chmod -R 755 /var/www</span></p><h2 id="h.9ywxgyd4a23o-12" style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;font-weight:700;padding-left:0;font-size:12pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.0;page-break-after:avoid;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Courier New";font-style:normal"> </span></h2><div>
</div> </body>
</html>

We’ll copy it over to create a virtual host file for each of our domains.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Create the First Virtual Host File</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Start by copying the file for the first domain:</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">- sudo cp /etc/apache2/sites-available/000-default.conf /etc/apache2/sites-available/moodle.com.conf            </span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Open the new file in your editor (we’re using vim below) with root privileges:</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p Modify the highlighted text below for your own circumstances.</span></p><p When using them, the ability to serve multiple websites is based on the client request IP:PORT combination.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">To use this type of virtual hosts, a machine must have multiple network addresses. This doesn’t mean that multiple physical network interfaces are required, since multiple addresses can be assigned to the same interface ( this is called IP aliasing), and virtual interfaces can also be </span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#0e0618;font-weight:400;font-size:13.5pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:italic">sudo vim /etc/apache2/ports.conf</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span> Add the following <br><br></span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Listen 8080</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"><VirtualHost 93.184.216.34:80></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">  ServerName: moodle.local</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">  DocumentRoot "/var/www/moodle.com/html"</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></VirtualHost></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"><VirtualHost 93.187.216.34:8080></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">  ServerName video.local</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">  DocumentRoot "/var/www/video.com/html"</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></VirtualHost></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Above we can see that even if the two virtual hosts have the same IP address, a different port is specified in the second example: 8080. In order for the server to be able to listen to that port we use the Listen 8080 directive.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:italic">Enable the New Virtual Host Files</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:italic"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">With our virtual host files created, we must enable them. We’ll be using the a2ensite tool to achieve this goal.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span>·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:400">             </span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">sudo a2ensite moodle.com.conf</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span>·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:400">             </span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">sudo a2ensite video.com.conf</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span>·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:400">             </span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">sudo a2ensite project.com.conf </span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Next, disable the default site defined in 000-default.conf:</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">·             sudo a2dissite 000-default.conf</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">When you are finished, you need to restart Apache to make these changes take effect and use systemctl status to verify the success of the restart.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">·             sudo systemctl restart apache2</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Your server should now be set up to serve three websites.</span></p><h3 id="h.ngabyhkqolkf" style="padding-top:16pt;margin:0;color:#000000;font-weight:700;padding-left:0;font-size:11pt;padding-bottom:4pt;line-height:1.0;page-break-after:avoid;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:11pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></h3><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:italic">Set Up Local Hosts File</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">If you haven’t been using actual domain names that you own to test this procedure and have been using some example domains instead, you can test your work by temporarily modifying the hosts file on your local computer.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">On a local Mac or Linux machine, type the following:</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span>·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:400">             </span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">sudo nano /etc/hosts</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span>·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:400">             </span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"> </span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span>For a local Windows machine,</span><span style="text-decoration-skip-ink:none;-webkit-text-decoration-skip:none;color:#1155cc;text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://support.microsoft.com/en-ca/help/923947/you-cannot-modify-the-hosts-file-or-the-lmhosts-file-in-windows-vista&sa=D&ust=1611126796133000&usg=AOvVaw3pPfIzR3HY3Qp5_QkVJTeH" style="color:inherit;text-decoration:inherit"> find instructions on altering your hosts file here</a></span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span>Using the domains used in this guide, and replacing your server IP for the </span><span style="font-weight:400;font-family:"Courier New"">your_server_IP</span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"> text, your file should look like this:</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Vim /etc/hosts</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">127.0.0.1   localhost</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">127.0.1.1   guest-desktop</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">your_server_IP moodle.com</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">your_server_IP video.com</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">your_server_IP project.com</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"> </span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Save and close the file. This will direct any requests for example.com and test.com on our computer and send them to our server.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"> </span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><div>
</div> </body>
</html>

your setup by going to the domains that you configured in your web browser:</span></p><p style="border-right-style:solid;padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;border-top-width:0pt;border-right-width:0pt;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;border-top-style:solid;border-bottom-width:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";border-bottom-style:solid;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span moodle page</span></p><p style="border-right-style:solid;padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;border-top-width:0pt;border-right-width:0pt;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.4;border-top-style:solid;border-bottom-width:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";border-bottom-style:solid;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="border-right-style:solid;color:#000000;border-top-width:0pt;font-size:10pt;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:0;border-left-style:solid;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;text-align:left;padding:0;border-right-width:0pt;line-height:1.7;border-left-width:0pt;border-top-style:solid;margin-right:-115pt;border-bottom-width:0pt;border-bottom-style:solid;margin-bottom:0;widows:2"><span width: 601.70px; height: 41.33px;"><img alt="Apache virtual host example" src="http://bo.nts.nl/docs_extract_new/documentFiles/Copy2 of C001 Moodle tutorial/images/image64.png" style="width: 601.70px; height: 41.33px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p><p created for your second site.</span></p><p style="border-right-style:solid;padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;border-top-width:0pt;border-right-width:0pt;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;border-top-style:solid;border-bottom-width:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";border-bottom-style:solid;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="background-color:#f2f2f2;color:#545454;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10.5pt;font-family:"Courier New";font-style:normal">http://<IP Address:8080></span></p><p style="border-right-style:solid;padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;border-top-width:0pt;border-right-width:0pt;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.4;border-top-style:solid;border-bottom-width:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";border-bottom-style:solid;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="background-color:#f2f2f2;color:#545454;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10.5pt;font-family:"Courier New";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="border-right-style:solid;color:#000000;border-top-width:0pt;font-size:10pt;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:0;border-left-style:solid;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;text-align:left;padding:0;border-right-width:0pt;line-height:1.7;border-left-width:0pt;border-top-style:solid;margin-right:-115pt;border-bottom-width:0pt;border-bottom-style:solid;margin-bottom:0;widows:2"><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 2.00px solid #e5e5e5; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 601.70px; height: 42.67px;"><img alt="Apache virtual host test" src="http://bo.nts.nl/docs_extract_new/documentFiles/Copy2 of C001 Moodle tutorial/images/image117.png" style="width: 601.70px; height: 42.67px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p><p style="border-right-style:solid;color:#000000;border-top-width:0pt;font-size:10pt;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:0;border-left-style:solid;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;text-align:left;padding:0;border-right-width:0pt;line-height:1.7;border-left-width:0pt;border-top-style:solid;margin-right:-115pt;border-bottom-width:0pt;border-bottom-style:solid;margin-bottom:0;widows:2"><span style="font-size:12pt;font-family:"Roboto";color:#333333;font-weight:400">If both of these sites work as expected, you’ve configured </span><span style="font-size:12pt;font-family:"Roboto";color:#333333;font-weight:700">two</span><span style="color:#333333;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:12pt;font-family:"Roboto";font-style:normal"> virtual hosts on the same server.</span></p><p style="border-right-style:solid;color:#000000;border-top-width:0pt;font-size:10pt;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:0;border-left-style:solid;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;text-align:left;padding:0;border-right-width:0pt;line-height:1.7;border-left-width:0pt;border-top-style:solid;margin-right:-115pt;border-bottom-width:0pt;border-bottom-style:solid;margin-bottom:0;widows:2"><span style="color:#333333;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:12pt;font-family:"Roboto";font-style:normal">If you adjusted your home computer’s hosts file, delete the lines you added.</span></p><p style="border-right-style:solid;padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;border-top-width:0pt;border-right-width:0pt;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;border-top-style:solid;border-bottom-width:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";border-bottom-style:solid;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="background-color:#f2f2f2;color:#545454;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10.5pt;font-family:"Courier New";font-style:normal"></span></p><div>
</div> </body>
</html>

Run the following commands one by one</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span>·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:400">             </span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">sudo cp –R /home/$USER/Desktop/videoserver/moodle/* /var/www/moodle.com/html</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span>·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:400">             </span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">sudo cp –R /home/$USER/Desktop/videoserver/video-server/* /var/www/video.com/html</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span>·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:400">             </span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">sudo cp –R /home/$USER/Desktop/videoserver/project/* /var/www/project.com/html</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"> </span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><div>
</div> </body>
</html>

style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Note - If you are not comfortable using terminal to create the config.php file that needs to be created when going through the installer, you should temporarily make the webroot writable by doing the following:</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">> sudo chmod -R 777 /var/www/moodle.com/html</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">After you have ran the installer and you have moodle setup, you NEED to revert permissions so that it is no longer writable using the below command.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">> sudo chmod -R 0755 /var/www/moodle.com/html Open your browser and go to </span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span haven't been installed.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Output</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Query OK, 1 row affected (0.00 sec)</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Then exit the MySQL shell by pressing CTRL+D. From the normal command line, you can import the dump file with the following command:</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">·         mysql -u username -p nts_training < videoserver.sql</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><ul class="lst-kix_po4jj7424p3i-0 start" style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">username is the username you can log in to the database with</span></li><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">newdatabase is the name of the freshly created database</span></li><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">videoserver.sql is the data dump file to be imported, located in the Desktop/videoserver directory</span></li></ul><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Move the video-server directory from Desktop/videoserver/video_server/* to video.com site directory with the following commands</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">sudo chmod -R 0755 /var/www/moodle.com/html</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"> </span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">sudo cp –R /home/$USER/Desktop/videoserver/video_server/*  /var/www/video.com/html</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"> </span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Complete the setup</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Configure database by editing Database.php, Run the command bellow</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"> </span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">sudo vim /var/www/video.com/app/Stream/config/database.php</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"><br>You should see a file that looks like this</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Courier New";font-style:normal">class Database {</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Courier New";font-style:normal">         private $host = "__your_host__";</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Courier New";font-style:normal">         private $db = "nts_training";</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Courier New";font-style:normal">         private $username = "__your_db_username__";</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Courier New";font-style:normal">         private $password = "__your_db_password__";</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Courier New";font-style:normal">         …</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Courier New";font-style:normal">}</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Courier New";font-style:normal">Replace $host, $username, $password with your credentials</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Hit :wq to save and quit file</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Now test the installation</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">http://IP.ADDRESS.OF.SERVER.FOR.VIDEO/</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><div>
</div> </body>
</html>
